data.name: Interlaken Free Walking Tour
data.abstract: Interlaken – a jewel in the midst of the Swiss Alps. A local guide shares exciting facts about Interlaken and its environs with the guests. They will visit secret spots that only the locals know, looking at them through their eyes.
data.description: The very first tour of this kind in Switzerland has been very well received by all guests. The guides are from the region. They know the area, its history and secrets and have excellent language skills, especially in English, but they are fluent in other languages as well. In addition to the professional organisation, the tours are fresh, exciting and entertaining. The two-hour event is free, but the guests have an opportunity to tip the guide at the end.

data.name: Interlaken - the paradise for water sports
data.abstract: The region around Interlaken offers a variety of water sports and thus, fun and excitement for everyone.
data.description:
Whether an intoxicating kayak tour on the glassy surface of Lake Brienz or a ride on the waves of a wild mountain stream; the region around Interlaken offers water sports enthusiasts a large choice. During guided tours, which do not require any prior knowledge, hikers get to enjoy the breathtaking nature or search for the next adrenaline rush.

These are the activities on offer: 

• SUP 
• kayaking 
• canoeing 
• canyoning 
• river rafting 
• boat hire 
• wakesurfing 
• water skiing 
• wakeboarding 
• pedaloing

More information [http://www.interlaken.ch/en/activities-excursions-adventure-festivals/summer-sports-and-adventure/water-sports-interlaken.html]

data.name: Interlaken - First ski experience - Full-day
data.abstract: An all day package especially for first time skiers
data.description:
Full-day special offer for beginner skiers

Are you a beginner looking to try skiing or snowboarding for the first time? Spend a day in the snow and carve out your first turns on simple terrain under the professional instruction of our ski or snowboard instructors. We’ll organise the equipment, ski pass and instruction for you so you can fully concentrate on your snow sports adventure. Lessons are provided in small groups of up to eight people, guaranteeing plenty of fun and maximum success!

Included in the price: 

Full-day ski, pole and helmet hire
Full-day lift pass (valid for the bodmiARENA beginners’ area)
Full day of ski instruction
Transport

data.name: Interlaken - First ski experience - Half-day
data.abstract: This half-day beginners’ course is perfect for anyone looking to take their first foray into the world of skiing. Our professional snow sports instructors will teach you the basics of how to ski over the 2.5-hour course.
data.description:
This half-day beginners’ course is perfect for anyone looking to take their first foray into the world of skiing. Our professional snow sports instructors will teach you the basics of how to ski over the 2.5-hour course. You’ll get the chance to practise your new-found skills on the bodmiARENA, the largest beginners’ ski area in Grindelwald with glorious views of the Eiger’s north face.

Included in the price: 

Collection from your hotel in Interlaken

1/2 day’s ski, boot and helmet hire
1/2 day’s pass
2.5-hour skiing lesson
Collection and return transport

data.name: Funky chocolate club Interlaken
data.description: Welcome to the sweet universe of Tatjana and Michaela. In their chocolate studio in Interlaken the guests produce their own masterpiece from 400 g of Swiss chocolate. The chocolate makers help with melting and decorating. The guests can then take their chocolate souvenir home.

price.description: CHF 65.00 per adult CHF 59.00 per child

data.name: Walking tour in Interlaken
data.description: A walking tour through Interlaken means experiencing the town and its history first hand. The interactive tour is organised by local guides. They take their guests through the vegetable garden of the Zwahlen family, have them taste cheese in stately cellars and show them places that nobody else knows.

data.name: Harderbahn
data.abstract: In just ten minutes, the panorama funicular takes guests from Interlaken up to its local mountain Harder Kulm.
data.description:
For more than 100 years, the funicular has been negotiating the 735 meters of altitude to the Harder Kulm, located at 1322 meters. The journey starts not far from Interlaken Ost station, leads through a charming forest and passes the wildlife park. A five-minute walk takes visitors from the mountain station to the lovely restaurant with turrets and a red tile roof. Next to the restaurant, guests may visit the “Two-Lakes-Bridge” and an airy viewing platform with a glass area in its floor. From there, truly deep sights can be seen and the magnificent view to Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau as well as Lakes Brienz and Thun can be savoured.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 1322 m a.s.l. Arrival: Walkway (7 min) from Interlaken Ost station to Harder railway, funicular to Harder Kulm Timetable: Operates during the summer season in 30-minute intervals.Timetable [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/live/operating-info/]

Travel duration to summit: 10 mins Attractions: “Floating” triangular viewing platform Culinary aspects: Pavilion style restaurant
Specials: Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/harder-kulm/]



MOUNTAIN DAY TRIPS
Buy your mountain rail ascent return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/en/buying/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=HarderKulm]

data.name: Bernese Oberland – Railway
data.abstract: The Bernese Oberland valley railroad was opened in 1890 and has been been electrified since 1914. It connects Interlaken (Interlaken East) with Grin with Grindelwald and Lauterbrunnen. Besides serving the resort towns, it also enables access to the world famous Jungfraujoch-Top of Europe.
data.description:
As a rule two trains coupled together ride up to Zweilütschinen where they are separated. One train travels to Grindelwald, the other one to Lauterbrunnen. 

The Bernese Oberland valley train presents itself as a modern shuttle that opens up the tourism centers in the Eiger, Mönch & Jungfrau Region.

data.name: Zentralbahn
data.abstract: The Zentralbahn connects Lucerne and Engelberg, passing through Stans and also runs between Lucerne and Interlaken East (see GoldenPass Line) passing by Sarnen and the Brünig Pass.
data.description:
Routes:
Lucerne - Stans - Engelberg (- Titlis)
Lucerne - Sarnen - Brünig - Meiringen - Interlaken East

In a bit less than an hour, the Zentralbahn brings you from Lucerne with its glittering lake to the fascinating Alpine world of Engelberg, home to one of Switzerland's famous cloisters. 

Getting there is half the fun and so it is with this trip that goes through many charming villages and unique vista points. 

Option: Ascend Mount Titlis with the world's first rotating cable car. Once there, admire the glacier and the grandiose alpine panorama from an altitude of 3020 m a.s.l. or visit the Ice Grotto, the Glacier Park, enjoy a ride on the chair-lift «Ice Flyer» or test your mettle on a «Trottibike». 


BRÜNIG SAFARI AND LIVEGUIDE

Brünig Safari [http://www.zentralbahn.ch/en/node/70]From May until October, you can discover 13 native wild animals – made from wood! They are positioned in their natural environments along the Giswil – Meiringen line so as to be visible from the train. The Brünig Safari flyer contains interesting and unusual details about the animals and their lifestyles.

LiveGuide [http://www.zentralbahn.ch/en/node/322] Thanks to the multimedia LiveGuide app, travellers obtain background information on the Zentralbahn, the route and the most fascinating sights along the way. A short film also shows the loveliest points on the route from the driver's vantage point.

data.name: Funky Chocolate Club
data.abstract: In the Chocolate Laboratory® at the Funky Chocolat Club in Interlaken, guests will be supplied with aprons, chef hats and all the ingredients. Professional chocolatiers will share the techniques, tips and tricks of tempering of chocolate, melting, pouring and filling molds.
data.description:
Visitors of the Funky Chocolat Club can learn how to taste chocolate like a professional Swiss connoisseur. Types, quality and cocoa percentage can be recognised after this introduction. Furthermore, own chocolate masterpieces can be created and decorated within the Chocolate Laboratory with the help of professional chocolatiers. 

The chocolate dream is not over yet. The site inlcudes two more attractions where relishing the delicious chocolate is possible: 

Chocolate shop 

Organic- and fair trade chocolate from certified producers can be bought here. You will also find vegan, dairy-free, gluten-free or nut-free varieties. 

Chocolate bar 

Hot chocolate, chocolate fondue and chocolate-dipped strawberrys are served

data.name: Photo Spot St. Beatus Caves
data.abstract: In the St. Beatus Caves by Lake Thun near Interlaken. Explore around one kilometre of safe and well-lit walkways inside the mountain. Discover stalactites and stalagmites that have been formed by nature over millions of years as you immerse yourself in this unique underground world. A visit to the Cave Museum is a chance to learn more about this natural wonder, with an audio guide telling you all you need to know about caves and caving.

data.name: GoldenPass Express
data.abstract: The GoldenPass Express redefines the travel experience between Interlaken and Montreux.
data.description:
SEAMLESS TRAVEL EXPERIENCE
The GoldenPass Express provides a seamless and even more comfortable travel experience on one of Switzerland’s most picturesque train routes. The panoramic train will connect Interlaken with Montreux up to four times a day, offering uninterrupted views of the breathtaking panorama.PRESTIGE
The travel class “Prestige” is the centrepiece of the train. It offers everything you would expect from an unforgettable train journey: plenty of privacy, maximum comfort in a small compartment, and an exceptional culinary offering.

Make yourself comfortable on the luxurious and heated leather seats, which can be rotated 180 degrees upon request. The travel class is also elevated by 40 cm compared to the other travel classes, offering you an even better view of the fascinating scenery.

CULINARY DELIGHTS ON THE GOLDENPASS EXPRESS
Local and international delicacies can be ordered in advance, ensuring a perfect start to an exciting journey. For example, how about a glass of champagne and a portion of the finest caviar from Frutigen in Switzerland?

If you prefer to pamper your palate with regional delicacies, you won’t be disappointed with a traditional apéro-plate or a vegetarian alternative. While champagne and caviar are served exclusively in “Prestige” and 1st class, you can enjoy selected dishes from the small but exquisite menu in all travel classes.

WORLD-FAMOUS PLACES, THREE REGIONS
The journey on the GoldenPass Express is like a foray through Switzerland. The trip starts in picturesque Interlaken and continues via Gstaad, Château-d’Oex and Montbovon to Montreux, the journey’s final stop. Of course, you can also start your trip in Montreux.

Interlaken is a great base for numerous activities and boasts incredible views of Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau. Luxurious Gstaad is known for its charming chalets and is a favourite holiday spot among stars and winter sports enthusiasts alike. Château-d’Oex is known for its hot air balloons and, with a little luck, you might spot one aloft. Montreux, of course, is home to the annual Montreux Jazz Festival [https://www.montreuxjazzfestival.com/en/].


SWISSNESS
The GoldenPass Express is a world-first and a Swiss masterstroke. After all, the idea of connecting Interlaken and Montreux without needing to change trains originated more than 100 years ago. The project never materialised, however, because of the different track gauges of the respective sections of the line. But this seemingly impossible challenge could now be solved by an ingenious invention: adjustable bogies.
GOLDENPASS EXPRESS TIMETABLE


The current timetable as well as additional information can be found here [https://www.gpx.swiss/en/pages/timetable].


RESERVATIONS AND SURCHARGES
Due to limited seating capacity, reservations are mandatory in “Prestige” (CHF 49) and strongly recommended for 1st and 2nd class travel. This is in addition to a valid ticket for the selected travel class.

The only thing you might find disappointing? The entire trip lasts just 3 hours 15 minutes. With those stunning views and unrivalled comfort, the journey is just as spectacular as the destination.


SWISS TRAVEL PASS
This route is fully included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) / GA Travelcard, though seat reservations must be paid for separately. 
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]

data.name: Paradise for adventure and paragliding
data.abstract: Interlaken is the number one place for fun and adventure sports. For paragliding fans, Interlaken has long been known for its excellent flying opportunities and nearly year-round good conditions.
data.description:
On a round tour of the Alps you can enjoy the high-alpine panorama, or on a hang-gliding or paragliding trip you can admire the scenery somewhat more closely while a parachute jump will certainly get your adrenalin going.

Tandem flights: in Interlaken there is a wide range of unique opportunities for paragliding and seeing extraordinary views of the lakes and mountains. As a passenger, you need no previous experience; you are given a few instructions and then a few steps later you lift off with your pilot. Getting an unusual bird's eye view of the unique Jungfrau panorama is sure to make you forget everything else for a while!
Nothing can beat the flight down from the Beatenberg to Interlaken for excitement and a really special experience.

data.name: Raclette rafting
data.abstract: Enjoy a tasty raclette while drifting on a rafting boat from the quay in Bönigen through the ship canal to Interlaken.
data.description: The raft is stable and the tours take place in the evening. While the lights in the houses of Interlaken slowly go on along the banks, guests snuggle down in warm blankets to enjoy a feast of melted cheese and a glass of wine. The views of the snow-covered mountains in the background complement the idyllic cityscape. The reliable guides steer the vessel, so that guests can enjoy the time on the raclette raft.

data.name: Swiss Food and Culture Tour
data.description: Following a culinary introduction to Swiss food and culture with a cheese tasting in the centre of Interlaken, you will visit a chocolate shop and a local woodcarver, who specialises in traditional handicrafts from the Bernese Oberland. Finally, you will discover a local farm, where the farmer will guide you around key areas of the yard.

data.name: In your element
data.abstract: Experience the magical forces between the mountains and valleys: untouched nature, crystal-clear waters and snow-covered peaks provide a sense of wellbeing. Romantic hideaways promise unparalleled relaxation.
data.description:
Some places in the world just make you want to sing with joy. There are also atmospheric hotels to inspire you. Around Interlaken, unique hideaways can be found that promise a relaxing break from everyday life. The power of water is everywhere: The deep blue waters of Lake Thun, the magical turquoise waters of Lake Brienz, and the deafening Giessbach Falls are just as impressive in winter, too. The Seehotel Bären is a refuge of calm and well-being surrounded by crystal clear waterfalls, tranquil mountain lakes and energising alpine landscapes. When Monique Werro brought Indian medicine to Switzerland 24 years ago, some thought it was a sect. Today, Ayurveda is a recognised medical wellness treatment. The most ancient and comprehensive of all known health systems, this natural approach to medicine from India focuses on the unity of body, mind and soul. Food is also a big part of the Ayurvedic health programme. Chef Syril Josef spoils guests with Ayurvedic delicacies and Indian specialities. Ayurveda represents a holistic approach. As well as looking at the many aspects of human health, it takes into account how a person’s environment, such as the magical Brienzersee, can have a positive impact on healing.

Final tip:
For a particularly delicious way to relax and pamper yourself, look no further than Brienz, where cheese fondue is served outdoors in wooden hot tubs.

For reservation:

data.name: By E-bike through the Oberland
data.description: A guide from Interlaken who is familiar with the area leads the bike tour through the holiday region. With the E-bike, the group effortlessly discovers beautiful places away from the masses of tourists. They rest at a village fountain or on a farm. Individual E-bike tours are also available for groups.

price.description: CHF 79.00 per adult CHF 59.00 per child CHF 0.00 incl. equipment

data.name: Live Escape Adventure
data.abstract: MysteryRooms is a special Escape games, adventure games and team building events company. Whether for singles, couples, large groups, or corporate customers MysteryRooms develops special experience events that not only guarantee a high fun factor, but also promote team spirit and also require logical thinking.
data.description:
At the Interlaken location, there are two MysteryRooms that promise a lot of puzzle fun:

"The Secret of the Captain" is our game of chance and is particularly well suited as a first experience. The players are in the nostalgically furnished room of the Captain. The innovative rippled design offers exciting challenges in the areas of combining & concentrating, searching & finding as well as dexterity and sensor technology. A game that is played with all your senses.

Mind Games
The space of the player
Modern design, high-tech puzzles of cables, lights and computers and board games combine to make this interactive puzzle fun. You are in the room of the player, who seems to be a very sophisticated fellow and puts you to the test with tricky puzzles. You do not need to be a chess world champion to play mind games, but logical thinking and team spirit, as well as skill, is important to unlock the player's secret

data.name: Grindelwald First
data.abstract: The First is an ideal starting point for action-packed hikes, the new “First Cliff Walk by Tissot” being a prime example.
data.description:
The cable car whisks you in three stages from the valley station to Grindelwald First at 2,168 metres above sea level, a hotspot for connoisseurs and adventurers alike. The summit tempts visitors with breathtaking views of the north face of the Eiger and wonderful hikes. Lasting around two hours, the leisurely hike to the Bachalpsee lake is a must for anyone visiting the First area. The snow-capped Alpine peaks are reflected in the crystal-clear blue water – a pure mountain idyll!

Whether you opt for the 800-metre First Flyer zipline or a high-octane scooter ride, a rush of speed and adrenaline is guaranteed. The First Flyer enables brave souls to glide through the air for 800 metres at speeds of up to 84km/h. Children can enjoy the 700-square metre playground at the Bort middle station.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 2,166 metres above sea level How to get there: Train from Interlaken to Grindelwald, walk through the village (20 minutes), three-stage gondola to First Timetable: Operates during the summer season (April to October) Journey time: 25 minutes to the summit Attractions: First Flyer, First Cliff Walk, hike to the Bachalpsee lake, mountain hike to the Faulhorn and on to Schynige Platte (only in summer), high-altitude hike to Grosse Scheidegg (bus connections in summer) Food and drink: “Restaurant First” with seating for 350, sun terrace with seating for 300
Special comments: First Mountain Cart from Schreckfeld to Bort Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard: 
Your return ticket to the Grindelwald valley station is included in the price. Buy your discounted cable car tickets here [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/grindelwaldfirst/]. 



DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return rail and mountain ascent tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=First(Grindelwald)]

data.name: Schynige Platte
data.abstract: This great experience starts right when guests step into the coaches of the nostalgic cog railway. And the higher the train climbs, the more breathtaking becomes the mountain view that reveals itself.
data.description:
Guests visiting the Schynige Platte, located right at the heart of the Jungfrau region, on the historic cog railway instantly feel carried back to the Belle Époche. The wooden benches in the coaches of the nostalgic train as well as the vintage rolling stock dating from the nineteenth century exude the flair of times long past and revive the spirit of a bygone era.

 The mountain station at 1,967 meters is the starting point for various delightful circular hikes. It’s also home to the Alpine Botanic Garden [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/alpine-botanic-garden/] with some 800 plant species. The magnificent view can best be savoured from the panorama restaurant “Schynige Platte”, where guests are treated to delicious Swiss specialities as well as international dishes.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 1,967 m.a.s.l. Arrival: Railway from Interlaken Ost to Wilderswil, cog railway to Schynige Platte Timetable: Operates only during summer (June to October) Travel duration to summit: 52 minutes Attractions:  * Coach drive on the steep cog railway
 * Perfect panoramic view of Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau as well as Lakes Thun and Brienz
 * Free admission to the Botanic Alpine Garden with roughly 800 alpine flowers and plant species
 * “Swiss Flower Panorama Trail” with photo spot
 * Lily’s alpine playground and treasure hunt

Food & beverage:  * Mountain hotel with restaurant and spacious sun terrace
 * Snack-hut directly at the Schynige Platte station
 * “Bistro Breitlauenen” (intermediate station)

Specials: Daylong hike Faulhorn-Grindelwald/First, daily musical entertainment of Alphorn blowers, nature cinema and small railway exhibition in the mountain hotel Schynige Platte, barbecue area and leisurely panorama circular hiking trails (30 minutes to 2.5 hours), nostalgic steam train rides
Please note: Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass / GA travelcard
Buy your tickets upon arrival at the station or online [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/schynige-platte/schynige-platte-ticket/] 

MOUNTAIN DAY TRIPS
Buy your mountain rail ascent return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/en/buying/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=SchynigePlatte ]

data.name: Trail of the Three Waterfalls
data.abstract: Water may splash, and it can also babble, hiss, roar and thunder. For an exhilarating hike try the Trail of the Three Waterfalls from Bönigen via Iseltwald to Brienz.
data.description:
Begin of tour: ship station Bönigen Point of arrival: ship station Brienz Access starting point: bus, train or ship Access point of arrival: bus, train or ship Physical fitness: medium Difficulty: medium Hiking time: Total 5h15 / sections 2-4h possible Length: 18.2 km 
This hike is a very special experience for families as it is for all hikers young and old. The walk takes you to three spectacular waterfalls in the Interlaken holiday region. Depending on fitness levels the trail can be covered at one time or in three easy stages.

From Bönigen, Iseltwald, Giessbach and Brienz each of the other stations may be reached by boat, bus or train.

data.name: Hang-gliding
data.description: Nowhere else is the view of the mountains and lakes of the Oberland more beautiful than high above Interlaken. Tandem flights are available with an experienced hang-glider pilot. The hang-gliding season is a bit longer than the paragliding season – from April to November.

data.name: Eiger-Rotstock - via ferrata with a feel of the North Face
data.abstract: The via ferrata on the Rotstock, 260 metres in length, is a route for via ferrata walkers and experienced mountain walkers with a head for heights (and with the right safety equipment). The key to the climb is the vertical section immediately after the start. In the event of snow, strong rain or ice, this is very definitely not a route to be climbed. Like anywhere else on the Eiger, rock-falls cannot be ruled out.
data.description:
Difficulty
K2. Slightly to moderately difficult.
Valley/Starting-point:
Eigergletscher station (2,320 m), by rail from Interlaken Ost via Wengen or Grindelwald and Kleine Scheidegg (2,061 m).

Walk-in
From the Eigergletscher station, follow the Eiger Trail to the grassy hillock at Wart, and then follow paths up to the start point at 2,400 m, behind a mountain-top, with the Rotstockschlucht gorge immediately to your left: 45 minutes. 
Eiger-Rotstock via ferrata:
The course of the route via the new-old via ferrata is easily visible; easy walking sections are marked only with cairns. From the saddle of Rotstock, you quickly climb in stages onto the flat peak of Rotstock (2,663 m), with sheer faces on all sides; 1 hour 15 minutes from the start. 

Descent
Head back to the saddle and then to the south-west, across scree and slab sections (cairns and fixed ropes) down to the Eigergletscher station; 45 minutes. 


[/imglib/USP/k_buch.jpg] Quelle:
Eugen E. Hüsler/Daniel Anker: Wandern vertikal. Die Klettersteige der Schweiz, AT Verlag, Baden 2004  

Region: Bernese Oberland, North Wall of the Eiger 
Peak: Rotstock (2,663 m)
Time required: climb 2 hours, descent 45 minutes.
Variation in height: climb and descent 420 m.

For this trail, we recommend checking with the local tourism organization [https://grindelwald.swiss/en/service/operating-status/status-of-installations.html] in advance to confirm if it is open.

data.name: Sporty Lütschine
data.abstract: One of the best rafting trips of Switzerland. Rapid and demanding river, with the most beautiful and picturesque finishing spots of all rafting tours of Switzerland. No prior experience necessary.
data.description:
The Lütschine is one of the most interesting rafting rivers of Switzerland. Originating from Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau, the famous Swiss mountains, it carries their glacier water straight to Interlaken and into the Brienzer Lake. An alpine river situated in a terrific mountain and lake setting!

Section: Lütschental – Bönigen, approx. 15 km

data.name: “Prem Patra” – the love letter
data.description: This tour goes back to the beginnings of Bollywood in Switzerland. The guests visit the locations where the classics were filmed between 1964 and 1970, e.g. “An Evening in Paris”or “Prem Pujara”. In Interlaken, in the Aare Gorge and at Hotel Grimsel Hospiz the guests reawaken the splendid moments on screen.

price.description: CHF 0.00 excl. food CHF 0.00 incl. transport CHF 350.00 per person

data.name: Fixed Rope Park on Mt. Rugen
data.description:
Outdoor Interlaken inaugurates a fixed rope park in the Wagern Gorge on the Rugen. Nine Parcours of different lengths, difficulty and heights are planned in a beautiful forest with granite blocks dating from the last Ice Age, 18,000 years ago. This is an adventure for the entire family against the backdrop of the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau.
The fixed rope park is a 15-minute hike away from the train station Interlaken West. Parking is available.

data.name: River rafting Lütschine
data.description: The mighty Lütschine river offers exciting wildwater rafting, creating rapids as it surges down from the mountains. Led by an experienced guide, this rafting tour takes you on an exhilarating ride from Interlaken to turquoise Lake Brienz, where the journey comes to a tranquil end.

data.name: A trip for those in the know
data.description: Many Indian movies were made in the Lake Geneva region. The Bollywood tour starts in Interlaken and continues to three historic castles and to Lake Geneva and the UNESCO world heritage site of Lavaux. The guides know many of the details about the films made with Indian movie stars in this area.

price.description: CHF 0.00 excl. food CHF 0.00 incl. transport

data.name: Heiligenschwendi's Christmas path
data.abstract: On the Heiligenschwendi Christmas trail, six nativities tell the traditional history of Christmas in a most original way, with life-sized figures and animals.
data.description:
Ideal for a trip outdoors and to escape the end-of-year stress, the Heiligenschwendi Christmas trail lights up for visitors every evening during the Advent period. The life-sized figures and animals have waited all year to take up their place in the heights of Heiligenschwendi. The six nativities spread out along the trail are a fun and enjoyable way of rediscovering the stories of Christmas as a family. Depending on how fast you walk, the tour lasts between 30 and 45 minutes. The Christmas trail is not advisable for people who have difficulty walking or who are in a wheelchair.

More information under: https://www.interlaken.ch/en/experiences/tour/weihnachtsweg-heiligenschwendi [https://www.interlaken.ch/en/experiences/tour/weihnachtsweg-heiligenschwendi]

data.name: Golf in the Bernese Oberland region
data.abstract: The majestic Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau summits, crystal-clear lakes and picturesque villages of the Bernese Oberland present a natural paradise for all nature lovers.
data.description:

data.name: Kleine Scheidegg - First ski experience
data.abstract: Round off your stay in the Jungfrau Region by learning to ski at Switzerland’s highest-altitude official ski school. Your ski instructor awaits you!.
data.description:
To reach the winter paradise of Kleine Scheidegg you need to travel by train. Wear your comfortable everyday clothes on the train – the scenic route from Interlaken takes about 60 minutes and from the two valleys of Grindelwald/Lauterbrunnen about 30 minutes. When you arrive here at 2,000 metres above sea level, you receive all your winter sports equipment at Wyss Sport.

This is where you will meet your personal ski instructor, who, with ample humor and empathy, will be assisting you with your first attempts on the snow. After a few practice runs you will be able to brake, and it won’t be long until you are making your first turns on the snow. You will want some souvenir photos, of course, so do ask the instructor to take some for you. Let's ski!

data.name: Round Trip on the Kambly Cookie Train
data.abstract: The scenic Kambly Cookie Train connects the cities of Bern and Lucerne. Along the way, stop at the show confectionary where Switzerland's favorite cookies are produced: the Kambly Experience in Trubschachen.
data.description:
During a single day, visitors get to experience magnificent views of snow-covered summits while traveling along deep blue, pristine lakes, lush green meadows and picturesque farms and discover famous Swiss boutique cities. All those highlights are linked together on a scenic train ride rich in variety. 

On the Luzern–Interlaken Express of the Zentralbahn, guests enjoy a ride over Brünig pass, travel along five lakes and pass by a multitude of waterfalls and characteristic, quaint Swiss villages. The BLS Regional Express connects Berne and Lucerne, traversing the typical, rolling landscape of Emmental and passing the UNESCO biosphere Entlebuch. At the heart of idyllic Emmental, the train stops right in front of the Kambly Experience, where secrets of the art of patisserie are revealed. On the way there is the possibility to explore the interesting cities of Bern, Lucerne and Interlaken.FACTS
Route: Bern – Trubschachen – Luzern – Brienz – Interlaken – Bern
Distance: approx. 200 km
Duration: 5 h
EXCURSION TIPS
 * Schynige Platte – with its historic cog railway at more than 2,000 m a.s.l. 
 * Bern – historic city
 * Lucerne – Chapel Bridge
 * Harder Kulm – the local mountain of Interlaken

FOOD & BEVERAGES
No catering facilities on the train. Meal options in the cities of Bern, Lucerne, Interlaken and the Kambly Experience.TIMETABLE
All connections here [http://www.sbb.ch/en/home.html]TICKET
This route is fully covered by the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and GA travelcard.
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]
RESERVATIONS
No seat reservation possible – free seating.

data.name: Hasliberg Route
data.description:
In summer, from Brienz or Brünig-Hasliberg, the Hasliberg Route provides passengers a view of Switzerland’s largest open-air museum, namely Ballenberg. Brienz, adjacent to the attractive Brienz lake in the Bernese Oberland and famous for its traditional wood carvings is another beautiful spot- and one easily reached by rail or boat.

And a stop at the imposing Giesbach falls on a boat ride from Interlaken represents yet another highlight on this scenic route. Families are particularly attracted to the unique Zwergenweg dwarf’s trail in Muggenstutz (PostBus stops Twing and Reuti) and the promises of fun and adventure for all. And there’s even more active fun in store! The Haslital valley and sun-spoilt Hasliberg terrace are home to a large network of varied hiking paths – a part of which with superb views over the Engelhörner, the Wetterhorn group and notorious Eiger and Mönch summits. 

In winter the Hasliberg Route connects to the Meiringen-Hasliberg winter sports region; where visitors enjoy the sunny side of life along with numerous sportive and relaxing activities. Active ski and snowboard fans are delighted at the sight of 60 kilometres of broad and well-prepared pistes – a part of which, covered with artificial snow, guarantee winter sports fun in the absence of the real stuff! Moreover, our smallest guests are well entertained with suitable Skihäsiland lifts and playground infrastructure – and the promise of additional pure and healthy fun is fulfilled in winter with a number of beautiful hiking paths, exciting sled runs and cross-country course.
Additional useful information on the PostBus excursion routes and a wealth of pictures and video clips can be found at the link in the right-hand box.

data.name: Snowshoes, moon and fondue
data.abstract: Tramp through the night and the snow under the full moon or the new moon in style.
data.description:
"On the Lombachalp above Interlaken, guests strike the perfect balance between tranquillity and sports. This guided night-time snowshoe tour is an experience that is in a class of its own. The nocturnal atmosphere underneath the starry sky is so beautiful, you’re bound to fall in love with it. Accompanied by a mountain guide and equipped with a head torch, guests tramp through the enchanting winter landscape. All you can hear is your breathing and the crunch of the snow under your snowshoes. Step by step, you will advance through the atmospheric night, marvelling at the sea of lights in the valley, the snow glistening in the moonlight and the stars twinkling in the night sky. There is tea and mulled wine to warm you up along the way. At the end of the tour, guests can look forward to a fine cheese fondue in the Jägerstübli restaurant. 

"

data.name: BLS RegioExpress Bern - Luzern
data.abstract: The BLS RegioExpress will bring you to one of Switzerland's most original areas.
data.description:
Route: 
Bern - Konolfingen - Langnau - Trubschachen - Schüpfheim - Wolhusen - Lucerne

The BLS RegioExpress trains run between Bern and Lucerne at hourly intervals. Travel time: approx. 1h30.

The route from Bern to Lucerne through the Emmental Valley and Entlebuch is a secret tip among Swiss train routes. Typical for the Emmental are the farmhouses with deep roofs that dot the rolling hills. Cows grazing on the lush green meadows supply the milk for the world-famous Emmental cheese with the large holes. Visitors who continue their journey through Entlebuch traverse Switzerland’s first UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Fascinating moorlands and a multifaceted flora and fauna characterize this award-winning landscape. It is worthwhile to make stops en route: in Schüpfheim the PostBus “Panorama Route Express” awaits visitors and takes them through the Lammschlucht, a canyon, to Sörenberg and further on via the panoramic route to Giswil, where one can get train connections to Lucerne and Interlaken. The Kambly experience in Trubschachen, which lets visitors immerse themselves with all their senses into the secrets of pastry art, is worth a visit as well. Those who prefer exotic plants will be in their element in the Tropical House Wolhusen with its variety of tropical plants and crops.
No seat reservations possible.

data.name: Eiger North Face Adventure – Stollenloch
data.abstract: Fully equipped with helmet and climbing harness, you will summon the courage to tackle the Eiger North Face under the expert instruction of our registered mountain guides. The train to Jungfraujoch makes a special stop at the “Stollenloch”.
data.description:
Rising majestically above the glacial village of Grindelwald near Interlaken, the Eiger North Face has held great significance for the local population and the international mountaineering community for centuries. Numerous stories and legends surround this imposing rock face and have been passed down in books and films and by word of mouth.
Now you have the opportunity to experience this legend at first hand. Expertly coached by our experienced IFMGA mountain guides, you can try your hand at climbing the North Face of the Eiger, equipped with a helmet and harness. The train to Jungfraujoch makes a special stop at the “Stollenloch”.
As you experience this Eiger North Face adventure, your mountain guides will regale you with dramatic tales of climbers on this imposing rock wall. Given the dimensions of the wall (1,800 metres high), these stories cannot fail to impress. The emotions they convey will be etched in your memory and will encourage you to use our natural environment and its resources in a more sustainable way.
We do our utmost to ensure that our activities on the Eiger North Face and its surroundings are environmentally friendly and conserve resources. Our mountain guides take care to use natural resources sparingly and organise your stay on the Eiger North Face responsibly so as not to put additional strain on fragile ecosystems.
By imparting knowledge about the history and significance of the Eiger North Face, we engender an awareness of the beauty and uniqueness of nature among the group. This can help participants to be more aware of the environment and encourage sustainability.
By involving the local populace, the offer can be made even more sustainable. We are confident that our activities will help to ensure that the Eiger North Face and its surroundings remain a source of fascination and a place of beauty for a long time to come and that natural resources are used responsibly.
After the experience, you can either continue by train to Jungfraujoch or return to Grindelwald by train and/or gondola lift.

data.name: Giessbach Funicular Railway
data.abstract: Despite undergoing a number of technical updates, the funicular railway still radiates the same nostalgic charm and romance it did way back in 1879.
data.description:
The funicular climbs 93 metres along the 345-metre track from the hotel’s own landing stage (Giessbach See) to the enchanting Grand Hotel overlooking Lake Brienz. The four-minute journey takes you through the forest, over bridges and alongside waterfalls. 

The cascading waterfalls above can be reached on foot. There is even a path that runs behind the water, so you don’t get wet.INFORMATION

Altitude: 666 metres 
How to get there: 
Travel by boat across Lake Brienz from Interlaken Ost or Brienz to Giessbach See, then take the funicular to the hotel and waterfall
Also accessible by car 
Views: Towards the waterfall, across Lake Brienz to the Rothorn 
Attractions: Historic hotel, historic funicular, waterfall with 14 cascades over 500 metres 
Food and drink: “Les Cascades” fine dining restaurant 
Accommodation: 70 romantic rooms, tower room and suites 
Groups: Range of modern conference and meeting rooms (6 rooms, detailed conference and seminar brochure), banquets for up to 200 people 
Winter: Hotel only opens in winter for special occasions 
Special comments: An oasis of calm far away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life

Barbecue area, sunbathing lawn, concerts, events and even a restaurant. What more could you want? Young children can paddle and splash about in the new children"s experience paddling pool right by the Burgseewli.

data.name: Eiger North Face Trail: Hiking Along Mountaineering History
data.abstract: To this day, climbing the Eiger North Face is considered one of the most difficult mountaineering feats. One gazes at it respectfully and admires the tenacity and courage of the early alpinists who climbed mountain after mountain with little of the modern equipment we have today.
data.description:
The exciting story of these early mountain pioneers is retold on the two-hour Eiger North Face Trail which connects Allmendhubel to the Spielbodenalp via Mürren. 12 information posts explain the climbing routes, the gear that was used, and other related items. If one is lucky - and carries binoculars - one may well see the action live because there are climbers who try their hand at ascending the Eiger North Face practically daily.

How to get there:
Drive or take public transportation to Lauterbrunnen via Interlaken, from there to Mürren by train, from there to Allmendhubel by mountain train.

Trail description:
Between Allmendhubel and Schilthalp the well-constructed trail leads past colorful mountain flowers dotting the slopes the wayside and lush meadows. Return from Schiltalp to Mürren via a paved road.

How to get there:
By public transportation or car from Interlaken to Lauterbrunnen, by train to Mürren and mountain train to Allmendhubel.

data.name: Reichenbach Falls and Rosenlaui - Sherlock Holmes
data.abstract: The Rosenlaui Glacier, located to the south of Meiringen, in the canton of Bern, might be small, since it has an area of only six square kilometers, but thanks to this glacier two beautiful natural attractions have come into being - Glacier Gorge Rosenlaui and the world-famous Reichenbach Falls.
data.description:
The glacier gorge Rosenlaui is a natural monument of national significance. The meltwaters of the Rosenlaui Glacier flow thunderously through this ravine. A secured footpath leads through the narrow ravine, which is enclosed by up to 80 meter high rockfaces.

The meltwaters flow onwards to the valley and turn into the Reichenbach brook. The brook's seven-tiered waterfall has become world-famous, thanks to the writer Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. The protagonist of one of his novels, Sherlock Holmes, staged his own death on the observation platform above the highest of the seven tiers of the waterfall - the 120 meter high tier. A nostalgic cable car leads to this platform, and it can also be reached on foot from Hotel Zwirgi. 
ACCESS:
By public transportation (Brünigbahn) from Lucerne or Interlaken to Meiringen; you can reach the Reichenbach Falls Train by local bus or by foot. By car from Interlaken, Brünig Pass, Grimsel or Susten to the valley station of the train.

data.name: Easy Saxeten Canyon
data.abstract: Unsure whether canyoning is something for you? Well as easy, yet real canyon, there’s no better place to find out than the Saxeten Canyon!
data.description:
The canyon lies close to Interlaken’s tourism center, offering everything imaginable in the world of canyoning: Abseiling, jumps into pools of water and rocky water-slides – but in a slightly smaller and easier version as compared with most other canyons. And of course all this makes it a perfect place to cautiously get the feel and idea of what canyoning is all about! 

Thanks to a tour-length of just three and a half hours - from start to finish base - the Saxeten canyon is also ideal for those with limited time or wanting to invest solely half a day in the sport. So now you know! Nobody has to give up the idea of canyoning, and here you’re permitted an easy start with a few small and narrow spots, surprising water sculptures in the form of rocks, bubbling pool and small to medium-sized waterfalls. A canyon for all. INFORMATION

Canyon: Saxeten
Where: Interlaken
Activities: Canyoning
Levels of difficulty: + to ++

data.name: Jungfrau Park - The Fantastic Mysteries of our World
data.abstract: For the first time ever, the great mysteries of the world are available at one location to be experienced and sensed.
data.description:
Jungfrau Park is a place where visitors can gain insight into unsolved riddles through models and multimedia presentations. 
Once your curiosity has been aroused, you leave your everyday life behind and submerge yourself in questions surrounding the earth's unsolved mysteries. Jungfrau Park offers this variety and much more in a one-of-a-kind adventure park situated between two lakes in the heart of the Bernese Oberland at Interlaken, against the backdrop of snow-capped mountains.
Important information: 
Summer: The entire Jungfrau Park is open daily from May to October 
Winter: From November to April the children's paradise Mysty Land is open exclusively. 
More information about the opening hours: http://www.jungfraupark.ch [http://www.jungfraupark.ch/index.php?id=129&L=2]MYSTY LAND

In the Mysty Land in the JungfrauPark Interlaken, children's eyes are brought to sparkle. Large climbing tower, bouncy castles, and much more. Thanks to the large indoor area, the children enjoy on winter days, unlimited play pleasure. 

Opening hours:
4 November 2017 to 22 April 2018 
Wednesday - Friday, 1 pm - 6 pm 
Saturday & Sunday, 11am - 6pm 


More information:
www.jungfraupark.ch [http://www.jungfraupark.ch]

data.name: Sulwald
data.abstract: The nostalgic red cable car carries passengers from the sunny mountain village of Isenfluh above Lauterbrunnen up to the hamlet of Sulwald. The cabin has enough room for eight people or one cow.
data.description:
The small, almost nostalgic cable car has been operating since 1975 and is inextricably linked with the life of the local community. It carries passengers to a marvellous hiking area with unique views of the three mighty peaks of the Bernese Oberland, the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau.

From here you can see the Grindelwald valley, the Schynige Platte ridge, deep into the Lauterbrunnen valley and of course the three giants of the Bernese Oberland, the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau. Those wishing to explore the Alpine landscape can climb to the little Sulseeli lake and the SAC Lobhorn hut, then continue on to the top of the Sulegg (2,413 metres). Other highlights include a monster scooter track (toboggan run in winter) and a trail devoted to nature, folklore and physical exercise.INFORMATION

Altitude: 1,520 metres 
How to get there: 
Bernese Oberland Railway from Interlaken Ost to Lauterbrunnen, PostBus to Isenfluh, cable car to Sulwald 
Views: Lauterbrunnen valley, Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau 
Attractions: Mountain hikes, monster scooter track and exercise trail 
Food and drink: Sulwald-Stübli: cheese and game specialities (seasonal) 
Accommodation: SAC Lobhorn Hut (sleeps 24) 
Groups: ---- 
Winter: Open all year round, winter toboggan run, snowshoe trails, no skiing 
Special comments: There has only been a road to Isenfluh since 1962/63; a 1.2-kilometre spiral tunnel was added in 1992

data.name: Spiez Vineyard Sensory Adventure Trail
data.abstract: On the slopes of Spiez’s local mountain a one-hour viticultural trail reveals the secrets of winemaking in a fun way.
data.description:
The start of the trail is just 15 minutes from the train station, behind the winemaker’s cooperative building on Seestrasse. You can walk the full one-hour adventure trail or just part of it, as you wish. Flyers are provided in small boxes that direct visitors to the 12 information boards. Alternatively, you can also use your smartphone for an interactive experience. Scan the QR code on the boards to watch 12 short films that portray a year in the life of a winemaker. 

Making a small detour to the Spiezberg is highly recommended for the impressive views of Lake Thun and Spiez itself. If you’re looking for a cultural experience, pay a visit to Spiez Castle or drop into the viticulture museum to find out more about winemaking. On hot summer days, Spiez Lido on Lake Thun is the perfect place to cool off.

data.name: Quality and tradition – a perfect combination
data.abstract: What do the Victoria Jungfrau spa and the Swiss Mountain Whisky from Rugenbräu have in common? Both are top products with a long history.
data.description: Lodging in the best local hotel is already an exceptional experience. The large spa area and La Terrasse restaurant promise pure enjoyment, made even more exclusive with a private visit to the Rugen Distillery. One of its products is the coveted Swiss Mountain Single Malt Whisky “Ice Label”, which has aged in the eternal ice of the Jungfraujoch. To make sure that the guests can taste the whisky without worry while listening to the stories, a chauffeur will take them back to the hotel.

data.name: Paragliding in the Oberland
data.description: The dream of flying is almost within reach: On a tandem flight with an experienced paraglider pilot the passenger soars high above the lakes and mountains of the Bernese Oberland. The guests are well prepared before the flight. In the air, the passenger sits in front of the pilot.

data.name: Experience the stag rut in Justistal Valley
data.description: The stag rut in the Justistal Valley between Sigriswil and Beatenberg is a seasonal spectacle. Many of the region's stags gather in this valley each autumn. A local wildlife expert explains this wonder of nature to visitors. Lucky participants will see the herd of does, roaring stags or even two males battling for the favour of the females.

data.name: Eiger Run
data.abstract: Rumour has it that the Eiger Run is one of the most attractive and well-groomed toboggan runs in the Bernese Oberland...
data.description:
…But, what we do know for certain is that the Eiger Run is Switzerland’s most spectacular tobogganing descent. The route ends up along the foot of the Eiger and passes directly under the legendary North Face. The illuminated trail at night makes nighttime sledging a truly memorable experience.
Starting point: Alpiglen (1,616 m.a.s.l.)
Accessibility of starting point: Cog railway
Finishing point: Brandegg (1,500 m.a.s.l.)
Altitude difference: 116 metres
Length: 3 kilometres
Level of difficulty: medium
Toboggan hire onsite: yes
Illuminated for night sledging: yes
Option to eat: along the way, and at the finish

additionalDescriptions.description: What could be more inspirational for those taking part in your seminar than a mountain and glacier landscape viewed at 3,400 m above sea level? With all-year-round attractions on the Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe, your event becomes an unforgettable summit on the summit. The Bollywood restaurant is open from the beginning of April to the end of October.

data.name: Tempo 30 - Bort direkt
data.abstract: The blue piste that runs from the mountain station in Oberjoch to the sunny Grindelwald-First skiing region is one of the first in Switzerland with tempo 30 limit. This is directly linked to the Bort piste - one of the sunniest and most beautiful pistes in Switzerland.
data.description:
The tempo 30 piste is just perfect for perfecting skills or enjoying a leisurely glide down. And with a stunning view looking towards the Eiger, here you have close-up views of this glacial mountain world. Grindelwald-First is considered the sunniest ski resort in the Bernese Oberland, and a winter Mecca easily accessible by cable car from Grindelwald. Here you also find the start of the former world cup stretch at 2168 meters above sea level. The upper half of the piste leads over natural snow with stunning views direction Wetterhorn, while the lower section of artificial snow reveals capturing views as you look towards the Eiger. 
Info zu RailAway Angebote [http:// www.sbb.ch/snr-davos]
Starting point: Oberjoch (2500 m a.s.l.)

Accessibility of starting point: gondola, chairlift

Destination: Bort (1570 m a.s.l.)

Length: 4 km

Altitude difference: 930 Meter

Level of difficulty: easy, advanced (slowdown/limited speed slope, normal slope)

Food and beverages: at the start, on the way, at the finish (Adi’s Skibar, Berggasthaus First, Berghaus Bort)

data.name: Observation Terrace Sphinx
data.abstract: The Jungfraujoch is not only an attractive vantage point, but also an ideal location for various research projects in the fields of geology, astronomy, and more.
data.description: The laboratories are not open to the public, but their fantastic viewing terraces can be visited by all. They offer a panoramic view of the Alps and guarantee an unforgettable experience. Enjoy the high alpine wonderland of ice, snow and rock around the Aletsch Glacier, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Sphinx is located at 3571 meters above sea level. Europe’s highest railway station, nicknamed “Top of Europe” for that reason, is located in the interior of the Sphinx. A path specially prepared for leisurely walks leads from the Jungfraujoch to the Mönchsjoch Hut. The walk takes 1.5 hours, depending on weather conditions.

data.name: At night on the snow-covered mountain
data.description: Like giant fire bugs they climb at night across the white slopes of the snow-clad mountains and untiringly prepare the runs for the next day: the snowcats. The men in the cockpits of the high-horsepower caterpillar vehicles have a demanding and lonely, yet fascinating job. If you want to convince yourself, come and sit as a co-pilot by the driver's side and experience up close and personal what it means to be a piste-preparer.

data.name: Eiger Walk
data.abstract: There’s still so much you can read about the north face of the Eiger, but given the chance, why not experience the mystical aura and a dream come true!
data.description:
The two and a half kilometer stretch from the station of the Eiger Glacier up to Kleine Scheidegg bids an interesting hike that you can also make the other way round. Here’s the place to learn of the triumphs and tragedies that took place on the north face of the Eiger. And with the Eiger North Wall never out of sight, making your way along this particular stretch, diverse station are pointed out at which you can learn the turbulent history of the Eiger North Wall.

Inside the "Chilchli" in Fallboden you discover a six-meter high model of the Eiger with 14 different routes that traverse the north wall. One of which is home to the old Mitellegihütte that dates back to 1924 - and now serves as exhibition space for climbing equipment of both yesteryear and today’s more modern aids. And the names of all Eiger North Face climbers are engraved in natural stone by the Fallbodensee lake, which the Eiger Walk leads past. One is also reminded of the 69 climbers who lost their lives in their attempts to conquer the Eiger North Wall.

data.name: Mürrenbahn
data.abstract: Since 2006, visitors have been able to ascend the first 685 meters of the Grütschalp (1481 meters) by aerial cable car.
data.description:
From Lauterbrunnen to Grütschalp 
Since 2006, visitors have been able to ascend the first 685 meters of the Grütschalp (1481 meters) by aerial cable car. The cable car can accommodate 100 persons on each ride. At the same time it can carry 6,000 kilograms of freight. The ride takes 4 minutes. 

From Grütschalp to Mürren 
An adhesion railway runs on the romantic stretch across alpine meadows to Mürren. This ride traverses an additional 147 meters. 

Mürren is not accessible by car. For this reason freight transport is especially important. Transportation is carried out by means of containers, which are transferred to the freight compartment of the adhesion train at the intermediate station’s ultra-modern loading facility. 

The Lauterbrunnen-Mürren mountain train was opened in 1891. There is an additional means of traveling to Mürren: by aerial cable car from Stechelberg (the aerial cable car continues onward via Gimmelwald to Schilthorn).

data.name: Wengernalpbahn
data.abstract: The Wengernalp Railway (WAB) provides access to Kleine Scheidegg and connects Lauterbrunnen, Wengen and Grindelwald with the Jungfraujoch. As the longest cogwheel railroad in the world, it offers an impressive journey through the Alps and is indispensable for tourists, winter sports enthusiasts and locals alike.
data.description:
The Wengernalp Railway (WAB) connects Lauterbrunnen and Grindelwald with Kleine Scheidegg and serves as a feeder to the Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe. At 19.1 kilometers, it is the longest continuous cogwheel railroad in the world. In addition to transporting passengers, it also ensures the supply of goods for car-free Wengen. Modern low-floor panoramic trains with 152 seats run on both routes. The journey time is 24 minutes from Grindelwald-Grund and 42 minutes from Lauterbrunnen, with Wengen being reached in 12 minutes.

The Wengen Shuttle relieves the main line on busy days and increases the attractiveness of Wengen. Wengernalpbahn AG also operates the Kleine Scheidegg winter sports facilities with eight chairlifts as well as the Eiger Express, a high-performance tricable gondola for a fast connection to the ski area.

data.name: Alpine games team challenge
data.abstract: A variety of team challenges with the potential to unlock positive emotions are on offer in the heart of the fascinating Jungfrau mountain region.
data.description:
Divided into teams, you will compete in various challenging disciplines in a bid to take the title, with lots of laughs along the way.
Whether you prefer an alpine game that requires participants to demonstrate their skills, carry out traditional Swiss customs or simply rely on luck, the choice is endless. We would be happy to help you choose the games and plan your stay.
Once the game is done, why not celebrate the results over an aperitif or meal with regional produce from the Jungfrau region, sharing any outstanding achievements and laughing about any mishaps along the way.
Shared adventures in unique natural surroundings not only promote team spirit, but also highlight the importance of a sustainable corporate event. All our games require nothing but manpower, the venue is located in the heart of nature and is easily accessible by public transport – usually by train or, for an even more spectacular arrival, by gondola lift.
We aim to play our part by ensuring that our events are not only entertaining but also have a positive impact on the environment. Thatʼs why we make sure that our games are environmentally friendly and sustainable.

Our current range of games includes the following activities and is continuously updated:

 * Alpine horn challenge
 * Labyrinth
 * Eiger North Face climb
 * Milk stool curling
 * Maxi ski racing
 * Maxi Jenga
 * Snow sculpture making
 * Snowbike & sled trail
 * Photo shoot
 * Flag throwing

As organisers of corporate events, we attach great importance to sustainability and the responsible use of natural resources.

data.name: Indoor Rope Adventure Park Grindelwald
data.abstract: Visit Europe’s largest indoor rope adventure park at the Grindelwald Sport Centre...
data.description:
...in any kind of weather. It stays dry and windless in winter and cool in summer. This is your chance to experience the Eiger indoors!

On five different courses with 40 elements all about mountains, you will experience many highlights. Overcome giant icicles, soar through the air with the Haul Bag, or wend your way over the challenging Hintersoisser Traverse – in any kind of weather.
The Grindelwald Indoor Rope Park is open from Wednesday to Sunday from 2 pm to 10 pm (last entry to a course at 9 pm).  * Alternative opening times for the Indoor Rope Park can be requested for groups (min. 6 people)
 * Minimum height: 140 cm/4 ft 7 in
 * Maximum weight: 120 kg/18 stone 8
 * Children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult.
 * Children under 18 must have written permission from a parent or guardian
 * Free admission on your birthday (ID required)

data.name: Eiger Grand Prix
data.abstract: Creativity, team spirit, and above all fun and a certain air of nostalgia are the essence of this very special ‘Grand Prix’. Teams are presented with a basic frame and various additional materials, and have to work together to produce a colourful, working Go-cart. The culmination of this intensive team-building phase is the Eiger Grand Prix in which the handmade ‘racing cars’ will take to the course, and where the spectators can appraise the cars on their appearance, cruise control, and of course, their ability to pass the chequered flag! An inspiring competition for teams with a passion for driving and a sense of adventure!
data.description:
The event location can be reached on foot or by transportation. Once there, your teams of 8-10 people will begin building the new company car! Each team is provided with 2 axles with wheels, a variety of tools, and some construction and decoration materials and the team must invent its own imaginative name for its vehicle.
Further materials can be purchased at the ‘shop’, where teams use their own company currency – all teams have the same ‘budget’ allowance for their purchases. An array of materials such as metal parts, upholstery, wire mesh, cardboard, wheels, etc. may be fixed, hammered, glued, cut and sawn during the construction phase, and if larger cuts of wood are needed, there is professional carpentry assistance available in the ‘service workshop’.
Naturally, teams will be required to muster all their creative skills in the ‘paintshop’ for designing and painting the all-important team Go-cart flag. After the safety check, the vehicle goes to the test track - a proud and exciting team moment! All team vehicles will be judged and the winning team announced, according to a specific criteria; roadworthiness on the test track, design, the most creative team flag, and the most economical team (how much currency remains at the end of the event).

data.name: Snow sculpting - Awaken your inner artist!
data.abstract: In teams, participants design and construct small works of art out of specially prepared snow blocks. The finished creations will be presented to your fellow snow sculptors in an ‘art exhibition’, and evaluated by an ‘expert jury’.
data.description:
The outdoor ‘art studio’ is accessed on foot or by transportation. Divided into teams of 6 to 8 people, each will create its own themed sculpture out of a prepared block of packed snow, by means of a variety of specialist tools. Teams busy themselves with sawing, chopping, chipping, shaving, filing, polishing and decorating until finally, the finished snowy creations will be presented to the other participants and evaluated by an ‘expert jury’. Afterwards there is time to enjoy a well-earned aperitif whilst admiring the sculptures in total peace.

Optional activity combinations: Winter hike, Snow shoe hike, Sledging or Velogemel ride, outdoor Aperitif.

Rate: up on request.

data.name: Glacier Adventure on Jungfraujoch
data.abstract: Immerse yourself in the glacial world of the Jungfrau-Aletsch UNESCO World Heritage Site on a glacier hike and experience the magnificent alpine mountain landscape up close.
data.description:
Hiking across the imposing Aletsch Glacier is always an unforgettable experience. Surrounded by the most famous 4,000m peaks of the Bernese and Valais Alps, passing imposing crevasses and enjoying a breathtaking view of the immense alpine glaciers.

This unique adventure begins as soon as we collect you from the meeting point and accompany you on the journey by gondola lift and train to the Jungfraujoch. The Jungfraujoch is located on the main European water divide (Rhône/Rhine) at 3,454m above sea level, making this the highest train station in Europe.
Once you are roped up and equipped with a climbing harness and a ski pole, our IFMGA mountain guides will skillfully guide you across the glacier.

As we hike across the glacier, our guides will explain how we promote sustainability and the importance of preserving the alpine glacial region.
One of our focal points is climate change, one of the main causes of glacier melt. You will learn how climate change affects the glaciers, the impact this has on the ecosystem and the water cycle, and the importance of taking steps to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in order to slow down glacier retreat.

The walking distance and the speed of our progress on the glacier can be individually adapted to the needs of your group. After a break, you will visit the majestic Jungfraujoch under the watchful eye of your OUTDOOR guides. Visitors cannot fail to be impressed by this extensive and striking complex, planned and subsequently built in true pioneering spirit at the end of the 19th century.
The Jungfraujoch building is a prime example of sustainable planning and construction. The pioneering construction and the maintenance of the facility are perfect examples of sustainable building and the careful handling of sensitive alpine areas.

We visit the highest vantage point on the Jungfraujoch, the “Sphinx”, the Ice Palace with its examples of ice art, the glacier plateau and follow the “Alpine Sensation” tour, which provides us with musical accompaniment and interesting information about the planning and construction work on the Jungfraujoch. Along the way, you will learn key facts about the construction and maintenance of the Jungfraujoch and the ways in which it benefits science and the tourism industry.

This group activity on the glacier promotes team building, addresses the importance of preserving the alpine region, raises awareness and motivates visitors to make the long-term sacrifices needed to secure the future of the glaciers.

data.name: Fondue making - outdoor kitchen
data.abstract: The OUTDOOR team has found the most beautiful places in the Jungfrau region where you can hold an outdoor cooking event. Each cooking group will be provided on site with the cooking utensils needed for a fondue and a corresponding recipe for its preparation.
data.description:
What could be better than spending precious time together in the great outdoors, and what’s to stop you rounding off this moment with a meal you’ve prepared yourself?
The OUTDOOR team has found the most beautiful places in the Jungfrau region where you can hold an outdoor cooking event. Each cooking group will be provided on site with the cooking utensils needed for a fondue and a corresponding recipe for its preparation. After the work is done – under the starry sky and by firelight – you can enjoy your own fondue in a unique atmosphere and philosophise about past experiences and future adventures.
Experiencing communal adventures in the great outdoors raises our awareness of the importance of preserving nature. We reach our event location on foot, consume regional produce and together enjoy a traditional, culinary treat that we cook with our own hands.
We aim to show our guests that you can also pay attention to sustainability at an outdoor event and that we have a responsibility to protect nature and its resources. Our event is not only intended to be a unique experience, but also to help raise awareness of the importance of protecting the environment.
This evening will have a long-lasting effect, both as a social experience and a chance to encounter nature.

data.name: Igloo building
data.abstract: Construct your very own igloo under the instruction of qualified experts. Each icy block is sawn from the packed snow and must be placed methodically and with great accuracy. How would you measure up to the Inuit?
data.description:
Upon arrival at the ‘construction site’, teams begin the tricky creative task of building their igloo village. The snow ‘bricks’ are first cut from a snowpack which has been specially prepared by a snowplough machine. These blocks are then systematically arranged in a circular pattern and with each layer, the dome becomes steeper. Have you calculated accurately enough for the structure to hold its shape? How would you compare to the Inuit?

Optional activity combinations: Winter hiking, Sledging or Velogemel riding, outdoor Aperitif

data.name: James Bond Trophy
data.abstract: Audition for the next Bond film at the Schilthorn - we are looking for the new James or Jane Bond!
data.description:
At the valley station of the Schilthorn gondola in Stechelberg participants will be welcomed by the ‘casting scouts’ and casting teams will be chosen to make up the film crew. The new James or Jane Bond will also be chosen and on the way up to the Schilthorn there will be different tasks to solve as a team:
 * Team test on the Maxiski
 * Aston-Eigerkart Race with Go-carts
 * Photo shooting
 * Air pistol shooting
 * Hat throwing with Miss Moneypenny
 * Defusing a bomb (solve the quiz code)
 * Adrenalin kick on the Thrill Walk
 * Abseiling (optional)
 * Martini workshop and a visit to Bond world on the Schilthorn

Eat in the famous revolving ‘Piz Gloria’ restaurant, where you will toast the new Bond crew and of course, the new James or Jane Bond. The return journey will be by gondola back to the valley.

data.name: Snowshoe tour to the Lobhornhütte
data.abstract: A varied and moderately difficult tour high above the Lauterbrunnen valley.
data.description: Participants on this snowshoe tour have the peaks of the Jungfrau massif at their backs and the striking Lobhorn peaks before them. With your guide you first follow the Sulwald Trail in the direction of Mederalp, before switching to the Lobhorn Trail. From there, the path rises steadily uphill along the marked path, through snow-covered mountain forests and open plains to the Lobhornhütte. At the hut, guests can fortify themselves in anticipation of the upcoming descent with a warming meal or a drink.

data.name: Sledge building - Creative team fun with a top test-run!
data.abstract: Build a sledge from scratch using a variety of materials such as skis, wood, car tyres, upholstery, wire mesh or cardboard. Your team machine can be hammered, glued, cut and sawn until the finished sledge is ready for the initial safety check, and then given its very first test drive
data.description:
The construction site can be reached on foot or by transportation. The group is divided into teams of 8 to 10 people, and the task is to build your own working sledge and then to test-drive it. Each team has access to identical materials and tools which include skis, wood, upholstery, wire mesh, cardboard, paper, etc. Further materials can also be purchased at the ‘shop’, where teams use their own company currency and all have the same ‘budget’ allowance for their purchases. Professional help is available in the ‘Service Workshop’ for assistance where larger cuts of wood are required, and the finishing touches to your colourful team flag can be made in the ‘Paintshop’.
After the initial safety check, the sledges will be tested on the snow. The winner is the team that creates the most roadworthy, creative and economically built vehicle.

Optional activity combinations: Winter hiking, Sledging, outdoor Aperitif

data.name: Flag throwing – Tradition and flair
data.abstract: The remarkable calmness that radiates from a Flag thrower as they effortlessly swirl their fluttering flags through the air belies the technical training of a professional Flag thrower, who has mastered 99 different ‘swings’, with both their left and right hands, whilst making it all look so incredibly easy...
data.description:
The ‘Arena’ is reached on foot or by transportation where we will be greeted on arrival with a short performance from the professional Flag throwers. Participants will be divided into Cantonal (county) teams of approximately 6 - 10 people and receive an introduction by the professional Flag throwers to the art of this oldest of Swiss traditions. Afterwards each team will learn its own piece of Flag throwing choreography using both large Swiss flags and smaller Cantonal flags.
The finale will be each ‘Canton’ performing their own choreographed piece in a show, which is accompanied by folk music. Each performance is evaluated by the other teams and the Flag throwing instructors will also submit a professional jury vote.

Bad weather alternative: transferral to a covered venue.
